meanings.definition: A person who is opposed to something.
meanings.sent1: The aginner refused to join the new club.
meanings.sent2: She always plays the role of the aginner in our debates.
meanings.sent3: The aginner at the meeting kept shaking their head in disagreement.
meanings.sent4: He was like an aginner in a sea of supporters, standing firm in his beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The aginner's presence was felt strongly in the room, causing tension among the group.

meanings.sent1: Her aginner attitude made it difficult to find common ground.
meanings.sent2: The aginner comments only fueled the debate further.
meanings.sent3: Despite his aginner stance, he couldn't help but smile at the situation.
meanings.sent4: The aginner viewpoint provided a unique perspective on the issue.
meanings.sent5: The aginner tone in her voice was unmistakable, signaling her disapproval.
